list.desc: A crunchy delicacy. The faint creamy notes melt on your tongue as you munch on the succulent mushrooms and crispy bread. This unmatched sense of satisfaction somehow leaves you insatiable — you do not even hesitate to lick the bread crumbs off your fingertips.

list.name: Suspicious Milky Mushroom Crisp Tower
list.desc: A crunchy delicacy. From the sorry side of the dish, it is easy to tell that this dish has been left out here for some time — water loss has already dried up and hardened the bread slices. Biting into it makes your chin sore... Next time, do remember to eat it while it's still nice and fresh...

list.name: Milky Mushroom Crisp Tower
list.desc: A crunchy appetizer that's baked with mushrooms and cheese on top of bread slices. A single whiff of its amazing smell is enough to fill one with anticipation. Give it a bite, and you'll experience a pleasant burst of sweetness.

list.name: Delicious Sunset Berry Tea
list.desc: A fruity drink with a pleasantly sour taste. The redolence of tea carries your thoughts away. With one sip of this tea, you feel as if you are lazing in a flourishing orchard, tipsy in the gentle breeze that carries a fruity scent.

list.name: Suspicious Sunset Berry Tea
list.desc: A fruity drink with a pleasantly sour taste. You added sugar to temper the sourness of the tea but accidentally lost control of the added quantity. What should have been a thirst-quenching beverage has now become a throat-clenching liquid. Water, let's have some more water...

list.name: Sunset Berry Tea
list.desc: A fruity drink with a pleasantly sour taste. This scented tea gives off the pleasant aroma of fresh fruit. Its cold and refreshing taste is sure to dispel the stifling heat with each gulp.

list.name: Glabrous Beans
list.desc: A common legume in Teyvat with a light aroma. It can be prepared in a variety of ways, and is thus widely accepted by people all over the world.

list.name: Sumeru Rose
list.desc: Bright and beautiful, these pure purple flowers give off a pleasant fragrance that will give any passerby pause. While some like to call this a type of "rambler rose," its relative lack of multiple flowers means that it falls under a different floral classification.

list.name: Zaytun Peach
list.desc: The fruit of a forest shrub. Its flesh is firm and sweet. It is said to have a calming effect on the mind.

list.name: Delicious Tahchin
list.desc: A classic staple served in large quantities. With the first bite, the crispy outside cracks with delightful crunching sounds. The second bite combines the soft and moist rice with juicy meat in your mouth. Then, the third bite brings in the Padisarah's fragrance... The last bite, however, leaves your heart empty. What a pity it is, that you are too full to continue this wondrous experience. Well then, why not have another serving tomorrow?

list.name: Suspicious Tahchin
list.desc: A classic staple served in large quantities. Its dark-colored shell looks rather suspicious. A bite into its hardened surface feels like a duel between the teeth and the food. For the sake of your poor teeth, you decide to only eat the fillings...

list.name: Tale of the King's Squire
list.desc:
Through this tale, you can master the method to make the Bow "King's Squire."

This tale is about a girl lost in the forest maze.

"Once upon a time, there was a princess..."

list.name: Tale of the Portent
list.desc:
Through this tale, you can master the method to make the catalyst "Fruit of Fulfillment."

This tale is about portents and disasters.

"In truth, the moon did not always look like a pearl..."

list.name: Tale of the Moonlight
list.desc:
Through this tale, you can master the method to make the polearm "Moonpiercer."

This tale is about moonlight and magic.

"This story is about all the children who are fascinated by the moonlight..."

list.name: Tale of the Desert
list.desc:
Through this tale, you can master the method to make the sword "Sapwood Blade."

This tale is about a friend lost in the desert.

"This is a story from Valuka..."

list.name: Tale of the Forest King
list.desc:
Through this tale, you can master the method to make the claymore "Forest Regalia."

This tale is about the Forest King.

"The forest used to be a giant maze many, many moons ago..."

list.name: Midlander Bow Billet
list.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

list.name: Midlander Catalyst Billet
list.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

list.name: Midlander Polearm Billet
list.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

list.name: Midlander Claymore Billet
list.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

list.name: Midlander Sword Billet
list.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords.

Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.

list.name: Dendrocide Potion
list.desc:
A potion that boosts Dendro RES and suppresses the growth of plants.

Rather than killing the plants, it puts them in deep hibernation. It's also said to be good for the body if ingested.

list.name: Forest Essential Oil
list.desc:
Grants greater affinity for Dendro, boosting Dendro DMG.

It's a nourishing external medicine that promotes growth of plants, able to better channel Dendro energy.

list.name: Stories of You and the Aranara
list.desc: So many wonderful things transpired during your adventures with the Aranara. In the world of the Aranara where stories are highly valued, maybe someone is willing to "exchange" these with you.

list.name: Mini Seelie: Moss
list.desc:
A memento from the Lost Riches event. Equip it to obtain a mini Seelie companion.

A miniature green Seelie. It becomes most happy indeed when it gets close to a tree.

list.name: Exquisite Kamera
list.desc:
A Kamera that Razi borrowed from Lord Sangemah Bay. It will come in handy when you take photos of beautiful scenery, look for inspiration in the wilderness, or wish to keep festive memories!

This Kamera is adorned with metal decorations and thus looks a lot more expensive than regular Kameras. Be careful with it!

According to the leasing agreement, it can only be used within Sumeru's borders.

list.name: Ancient Iron Coin
list.desc: Ancient iron currency which, according to Ulman, is worth an awful lot of money. However, it doesn't feel like anything special to the touch...

list.name: Creative Note
list.desc: After much discussion with your companions during the adventure, you summed up some thoughtful suggestions on how Aranara Carvings can become more popular. Can be exchanged for precious treasures during the "Graven Innocence" event.

list.name: Whimsical Draft
list.desc: A quick sketch of inspirations for "Aranara Carvings" made during the adventure. Can be exchanged for precious treasures during the "Graven Innocence" event.

list.name: Original Fish Ointment
list.desc:
Specialized refinement material for "End of the Line."

Ointment refined from a catch from the great lake in the north. It has the effect of temporarily restoring the energy of the fish that could be made into fine bows.

It is said that in the lake dwell aquatic creatures that cannot be seen anywhere else in Teyvat.

list.name: Potato Boat
list.desc: A baked appetizer. The potato was washed clean and then baked together with cheese and Rukkhashava Mushrooms. The dish guarantees an unmatched experience when eaten hot. This explains its popularity on the streets of Sumeru. Still, be careful not to burn your tongue.

list.name: Show Me the Mora
list.desc: Dori's specialty. After paying a large sum of Mora, you finally got a chance to taste the dish cooked by Lord Sangemah Bay herself. Firm chicken is covered in the silky sauce with a smooth texture. With the mind-controlling charm of its great flavor, this dish is spurring an impulse in you to spend another fortune just to get another bite!

list.name: Fishing Line Stabilizer
list.desc:
A self-adaptive tension stabilizer that can be installed on a fishing rod to facilitate fishing. The device can automatically detect and record how hard different fish struggle. The more data it collects, the better the stabilizer works.

The device's prototype was the pointless invention of a Fontaine inventor that drew little interest for the longest time until the Fontaine Fishing Association discovered it and modified the product into the fishing line stabilizer used today. When the device first came out, it was most warmly received by the Association members, and now it has gradually been promoted in other regions.

It is an exceptionally hot commodity in the Snezhnayan market. Word has it that one of the Lord Harbingers is particularly fond of the product, which explains the hype.

list.name: The Boon of the Elder Tree
list.desc:
A talisman that can help collect wood.

Talismans of this kind are often seen in the forests in Sumeru. They possess the ability to gather the power of grass and trees.

To prevent the erosion of the forest and, in darker times, to resist the invasion of vicious monsters, trees and vines would form impregnable shelters together. Those who held "the Boon of the Elder Tree" were recognized by the forest as its friends and thus gained unfettered access to walk amidst the forest under the guidance of streams and moonlight. But that is archaic lore from a long, long time ago.

list.name: Scorched Starshroom
list.desc: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It seems to be a little singed.

list.name: Ultra-Hot Burner Lamp Test Model
list.desc:
A gadget that improves the efficiency of food processing by consuming minerals.

Young Akademiya researchers are accustomed to cooking with their experimental instruments. Someone invented an "Ultra-Hot Burner Lamp" that utilizes the energy of minerals to juice up the heat, all the better to save time and increase cooking efficiency.

The one you have is a test model for civilian use with power constraints and a dimmer flame, which should reduce its fire hazard rating. Even so, this convenient gadget is still perfectly capable of cooking jam and drying sausages with ease.

list.name: Viparyas
list.desc:
A flower without seeds.

Once the earth remembers, the Viparyas will bloom.

list.name: Dendroculus
list.desc: A substance that has accumulated intense Dendro energy. Offer it to the Statue and help reinstate the power it has lost over the years.

list.name: Sumeru Rose Seed
list.desc: A seed obtained from the Seed Dispensary. A quality seed full of life, just waiting to be planted in the fields of the Realm Within. After some time, it will grow into a Sumeru Rose.

list.name: Zaytun Peach Seed
list.desc: A seed obtained from the Seed Dispensary. A quality seed full of life, just waiting to be planted in the fields of the Realm Within. After some time, it will grow into a Zaytun Peach.

list.name: Harra Fruit Seed
list.desc: A seed obtained from the Seed Dispensary. A quality seed full of life, just waiting to be planted in the fields of the Realm Within. After some time, it will grow into a Harra Fruit.

list.name: Harra Fruit
list.desc: Growing in the hot humid rainforest, it is a fruit with a special spicy aroma. When ground to powder, spices can be made from it. It is the most valued spice plant in Sumeru.

list.name: Activated Starshroom
list.desc: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It seems to be bursting with vitality.

list.name: Scarab
list.desc: A tenacious beetle that finds repose within the vast ocean of desert sand. The golden pattern on such beetles' shells hints at some deep relationship between them and the ancient ruins that dot the desert.

list.name: Henna Berry
list.desc: A fruit that grows even in the most hostile of desert environments. Its vibrant crimson fruits are made even more lovely against a backdrop of yellow sand.

list.name: Light Guiding Tetrahedron
list.desc:
A core component obtained via defeating a mysterious ruin machine.

To this day, these ancient devices have not forgotten the dreams of their masters or their own duties: to build a thousand palaces, to administrate three thousand machines, to sow ten thousand flowers that shall never bloom again, and to recreate a paradise now buried beneath the desert sands for the sake of all who live in this world.

Though the lord of the desert no longer lives, and those dreams have long been corrupted by sinful whispers, and though all the magical pillars have been broken and have collapsed, the great beast once favored by the king hides still within the great searing storm.

list.name: Plume of the Changing Winds
list.desc:
Specialized refinement material for "Missive Windspear."

An ancient feather carved from turquoise. It was once used as an ornament or a token of sorts.

list.name: Perpetual Caliber
list.desc:
A motive device obtained from a mysterious ruin machine.

The machine it once powered may have been destroyed, but it continues to rotate all the same.

There should be no such thing as an energy source that can sustain itself forever in this world, and most research results obtained in the field of "perpetual motion" have been eventually proved false.

Yet, this device is proof that a now-destroyed civilization once reached heights that present-day nations could not hope to match...

list.name: Ajilenakh Nut
list.desc: A fruit that grows on evergreen trees within desert oases. The flesh under the tough skin is thick, sweet, and delicious, making it an important food source amongst the desert peoples.

list.name: Sparkling Berry Juice
list.desc: An all-new non-alcoholic beverage. Valberries of varying ripeness add layers of sour-to-sweet to this juice while the cooling sparkling water refreshes the soul — a fine companion for a pleasant and leisurely time.

list.name: Suspicious Fruits of the Festival
list.desc: A brightly colored non-alcoholic beverage. The sourness of the Wolfhook has not been managed well, leading to a numbing sensation on your tongue. Wait a minute... Is that howling from Wolvendom you hear? That's got to be a hallucination, right? Right?

list.name: Fruits of the Festival
list.desc: A brightly colored non-alcoholic beverage. Freshly squeezed Sunsettia and Wolfhook juices have been poured into a cup in a specific order. The cool and refreshing flavor and vibrant color remind people of the beautiful holiday times. Do not mess the order up if you want to get the gradient effect right!

list.name: Delicious Fruits of the Festival
list.desc: A brightly colored non-alcoholic beverage. The sublime enjoyment brought by the refreshing taste is almost like a sweet, illusory dream. One small sip transports you onto a white, sandy beach, where the sparkling seawater beats with the rhythm to which the hymn of your leisurely vacation shall be composed.

list.name: Recipe: Fruits of the Festival
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Fruits of the Festival.

list.name: Swirling Steps
list.desc: Nilou's specialty. The crystal-clear cup that reminds you of an ornate jewel case contains a soft, melt-in-your-mouth pudding. The reddish coloration, like a fleeting trance, reminds you ever so much of Nilou's radiant, dancing form. Ah, would that this dance might last forever.

list.name: Suspicious Padisarah Pudding
list.desc: A popular dessert in Sumeru. A single bite yields a mix of milky and floral flavors... Which isn't bad, exactly, but remains a far cry from what you expected from this pudding. Did you get the ingredient proportions wrong or something?

list.name: Delicious Padisarah Pudding
list.desc: A popular dessert in Sumeru. The moment it enters your mouth, the springy mouthfeel makes you feel like you're wandering atop milk-flavored clouds. As you savor its flavors, the blended fragrance of Padisarah and Sumeru Rose fills the air. When you finally do reach that very last bite, it feels like something has been left unfinished. You cannot help but lick the back of your spoon, as if to savor the final sublime moments of enjoyment.

list.name: Recipe: Padisarah Pudding
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Padisarah Pudding.

list.name: Padisarah Pudding
list.desc: A popular dessert in Sumeru. Juices are squeezed from the petals of Padisarahs and Sumeru Roses before being mixed with milk, gelatin, sugar, and other ingredients, and then left to solidify. Cute appearance and sweet flavor make it a common sight at celebratory events in Sumeru.

list.name: Suspicious Candied Ajilenakh Nut
list.desc: A rich dessert. The hard nut is almost like a stone lying hidden in the sand, waiting to strike. Sweetness brings happiness, yes, but the feeling of the hard bits stuck between your teeth rather ruins it by half.

list.name: Delicious Candied Ajilenakh Nut
list.desc: A rich dessert. The syrup itself melts upon contact with your mouth, revealing the nut like a gem swathed in velvet, layer leading on to layer of joy. One small bite, and it is as if you are soaked in a tub of silken sweetness. Why, you really, really must make a few pieces more next time!

list.name: Candied Ajilenakh Nut
list.desc: A rich dessert. First, the syrup is boiled till clear, then mixed with fillings and sesame paste from Sumeru. Then at last, the evenly-mixed syrup is poured into a mold and allowed to solidify into this crunchy form. It is said that the cold lands of Snezhnaya are a host to a similar dish, with a slightly different flavor profile. Of course, both sides naturally believe theirs to be the greatest in all Teyvat.

list.name: Recipe: Candied Ajilenakh Nut
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Candied Ajilenakh Nut.

list.name: Delicious Baklava
list.desc: A traditional Sumeru dessert. A certain researcher once said that the people of Sumeru can be split into two categories. Those who eat desserts to live, and those who live to eat desserts. The thin puff pastry layers of this dish, and the bone-piercing aroma of butter and honey, may yet consign all who taste it into the second camp.

list.name: Suspicious Baklava
list.desc: A traditional Sumeru dessert. The sickly sweetness explodes in your mouth like a bomb, leaving your teeth rattling in the wake of its saccharine shockwave. The appropriate amount of sweetness lifts the spirits, but too much of it becomes a terrible burden.

list.name: Baklava
list.desc: A traditional Sumeru dessert. This puff pastry contains chopped nuts and has been baked after having butter drizzled atop it — and not forgetting some syrup once it comes out of the oven. Some researchers will specially order this veritable "fortress of sweetness" to replenish their energies before an exam. This is also why this dish has great pride of place as the Akademiya's favorite dessert.

list.name: Recipe: Baklava
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Baklava.

list.name: Duel Soul
list.desc: Cyno's specialty. The golden grains of rice have been piled up like a most remarkable hill. As you scoop out a chunk and place the fragrant meat into your mouth, an impulse you cannot name rises within your chest — a desire to whip out your Genius Invokation deck and duel!

list.name: Delicious Aaru Mixed Rice
list.desc: A large serving of filling staple food. Each grain of rice is distinct and evenly coated in flavorful sauce as you spoon them into your mouth. No oily meats were used to make this dish, and yet its flavor is more alluring still. This dish stacks flavor like the endless dunes themselves, bringing a most unique satisfaction.

list.name: Suspicious Aaru Mixed Rice
list.desc: A large serving of filling staple food. In your hurry, you did not mix the various ingredients well before eating, resulting in a ridiculously thick tomato flavor on one side of the rice, and an utter blandness on the other... Best you mix it a bit better next time.

list.name: Aaru Mixed Rice
list.desc: A large serving of filling staple food. In this dish that combines rice, noodles, and beans together, the secret of great taste lies in the sweet and sour flavor imparted by tomatoes. Owing to its common nature and low price, this dish is a great choice for sating one's hunger — which is one of the key reasons why this recipe has spread from Aaru Village to the rest of Sumeru.

list.name: Recipe: Aaru Mixed Rice
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Aaru Mixed Rice.

list.name: Suspicious Charcoal-Baked Ajilenakh Cake
list.desc: A dark-colored pastry. One look is all it takes to tell that this is a disaster dish and a half. Your immense courage in trying one bite is rewarded with a supremely dry, coarse mouthfeel... Is this some kind of mistake? Was the charcoal plated up instead of the cake?

list.name: Delicious Charcoal-Baked Ajilenakh Cake
list.desc: A dark-colored pastry. The pastry is fine, almost lustrous, and the fragrance of the Ajilenakh Nuts is both vivid and full of warmth. The cake is fluffy and delicate as it enters your mouth, exorcising exhaustion and muzzling misery. Ah, just as a book may not be judged by its cover, so too should a cake not be convicted by its crust.

list.name: Charcoal-Baked Ajilenakh Cake
list.desc: A dark-colored pastry. The Ajilenakh Nuts were first roasted and powdered before being sieved, added to a batter, mixed evenly, and then baked. The final product by no means looks impressive, but it exudes the fresh aroma of Ajilenakh Nuts, and it tastes better still with some jam.

list.name: Recipe: Charcoal-Baked Ajilenakh Cake
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Charcoal-Baked Ajilenakh Cake.

list.name: Utmost Care
list.desc: Candace's specialty. The aroma of this dish hits your nose long before it can be plated up. It would seem that Candace's adept guardianship also extends to sustaining appetites... But, uh, this really is an extraordinary amount of Aaru Mixed Rice. How are you supposed to deal with this mountain of "overflowing consideration"?

list.name: Radiant Prism
list.desc:
An exquisite component obtained from defeating a Primal Construct.

The lord of the barren desert once had a dream, and once made a great many promises.

The legends of the desert say that these machines were originally vehicles for these unknown promises, which now live on only within their mechanical memory banks.

list.name: Turbid Prism
list.desc:
An old component obtained from defeating a Primal Construct.

It is said that these machines are different from those ruin machines that come from deep within the desert, for they were not made as heralds of destruction or conquest.

list.name: Damaged Prism
list.desc:
A damaged component obtained from defeating a Primal Construct.

These uniquely-shaped machines are the eternal sentinels of the desert ruins, and they possess the power to pierce the mountains and reshape rocks. The same principles that power many mysterious devices above and beneath the earth also power these machines.

list.name: Box Lunch from Tighnari
list.desc: Emergency food that Tighnari prepared for Haypasia. Paimon took a peek into the lunchbox, finding some traditional Sumeru delicacies that looked very tasty inside.

list.name: Fresh Nilotpala Lotus
list.desc: Flowers that grow in wetlands in the forest and bloom at night. Their fresh petals are important ingredients for the treatment of Eleazar.

list.name: Vintage Lyre
list.desc:
Use this traditional instrument from Mondstadt to play songs. It may work wonders when played in the forests of Sumeru.

A vintage lyre borrowed from Amadhiah in Vimara Village.

Mondstadt has a long-standing tradition of poetry and song. Bards from there tend to address their instruments as "Friend" or "Partner." Thus, one of them trusting Amadhiah with the instrument was nothing less than a gesture of intimacy and trust.

list.name: Jumpy Dumpty Party Popper
list.desc:
A party popper that, when used, unleashes streamers and confetti.

"Jumpy Dumpty is Klee's good friend and fish blasting companion! But if Klee brings Jumpy Dumpty to the festival, Master Jean will be angry... Don't you worry, though! Jumpy Dumpty has gained a new ability with Albedo's help! Just pull on its tail, and beautiful colored strips will come flying out!"

list.name: Cloud Retainer's Damasked Device
list.desc:
Made from stacked paper, this lightweight device has the appearance of a bird, and fittingly, was given to you by Cloud Retainer.

While it may be called a "device," you cannot see any traditional mechanical components here — well, not from the outside, anyway.

It seems that this adeptus' skills as a mechanist have improved even further...

list.name: Letter to Haypasia
list.desc: A letter from Tighnari to Haypasia. In the letter, Tighnari explains your identity and situation after coming to Sumeru and requests that Haypasia help clear up your doubts.

list.name: Sugardew Bait
list.desc:
The bait is based on rose dew and has been mixed with sun-dried Harra Fruit powder. It has a spicy taste and a sweet aftertaste, just like the life of a fisherman. The harvest after going through all the weather-beaten days and roaring waves is particularly gratifying.

Suitable for: Angler and Axe Marlin.

list.name: Strategic Inspiration
list.desc:
Materials that contain various theories and case studies related to mercantile practice.

To those with the appropriate experience, every page and every word is filled with possible inspiration for ways to improve.

list.name: Usable Funds
list.desc:
A sizable amount of Fairbrew Jelly, representing the base capital used in setting up your shop.

Attracting customers and increasing earnings — these two are the key goals of all shopkeepers. As such, you must plan out your spending and increase the attractiveness of your shop.

list.name: Quqing's Funds
list.desc: The funds possessed by the shop owner named Quqing. The Fairbrew Jelly within is meant to be used to purchase 65 boxes of Mintberries from The Cat's Tail.

list.name: Guanchui's Funds
list.desc: The funds possessed by the chef named Guanchui. The Fairbrew Jelly within is meant to be used to purchase 100 boxes of Fruits of the Festival from Angel's Share.

list.name: Guanchui's Invoice
list.desc: An invoice that Georg wrote for Guanchui. It records the price for the 100 boxes of Fruits of the Festival, the details of various fees, the transaction time, and the estimated time when the goods will arrive. This will surely put the client at ease.

list.name: Shevirme's Funds
list.desc: The funds possessed by the shop owner named Shevirme. The Fairbrew Jelly within is meant to be used to purchase 50 boxes of Fruits of the Festival from Angel's Share.

list.name: Business Earnings
list.desc:
A sizable amount of Fairbrew Jelly, representing the sum total of your earnings in this charity event.

As the Weinlesefest draws to a close, Bernhard will exchange these for Mora to give to old folks and children who need it.

list.name: Quqing's Invoice
list.desc: An invoice that Diane wrote for Quqing. It records the price for the 65 boxes of Mintberries, the details of various fees, the transaction time, and the estimated time when the goods will arrive. This will surely put the client at ease.

list.name: Shevirme's Invoice
list.desc: An invoice that Georg wrote for Shevirme. It records the price for the 50 boxes of Fruits of the Festival, the details of various fees, the transaction time, and the estimated time when the goods will arrive. This will surely put the client at ease.

list.name: Festive Fever
list.desc: Weinlesefest Festive Fever

list.name: An Ode to Khvarena
list.desc: Lore reportedly passed down within a lost religious group in the desert. Someone has transcribed it into a script.

list.name: The Shepherd and the Magic Bottle
list.desc: The story of a shepherd who came across a magic bottle within which an unexpected being was confined.

list.name: The Lay of Al-Ahmar
list.desc: A story about an ancient god whose name has been lost to history. The story is told by a floating Jinni. The veracity of the story cannot be determined.

list.name: Twilight Theater Head's Notes
list.desc: The script for "Drama Phantasmagoria: Tale of the Sword-Wielding Princess!" The meandering scribbles appended to the script seem to be annotations from the theater troupe head, some of which contain such radical instructions as to render their adoption unlikely in the extreme.

list.name: "Mushounin" Script
list.desc:
[Complete Act I]

A new film script that Xavier finished overnight, much thicker than his last one. What you have here merely contains Act I.
The willpower one can harness to achieve a goal is truly amazing.

[Complete Act II]

A new film script that Xavier finished overnight, much thicker than his last one.

The willpower one can harness to achieve a goal is truly amazing.

[Complete Act III]

A new film script that Xavier finished overnight, much thicker than his last one.

The willpower one can harness to achieve a goal is truly amazing.

list.name: Suspicious Biryani
list.desc: An aromatic rice dish. The rice grains are soaked in oil and have thus become translucent. Its greasy smell is rather unpleasant. A layer of oil remains on the plate even after you finish the dish... Best to stay away from greasy food for the next few days...

list.name: Delicious Biryani
list.desc: An aromatic rice dish. The golden crown made of long-grain rice and meat is adorned with Padisarah petals, a picture that reminds you of a desert dotted with oases. The enticing scent of spices dances across each grain of rice. Every mouthful soothes your whole body. It won't take long for a customer to empty the plate. They can' help but lick their mouth, savoring the lingering scent.

list.name: Acquaint Fate
list.desc: A seed that lights up the night. No matter the distance apart, guided by the stone's glimmer, the fated will meet under the stars.

list.name: Banu's Wisdom
list.desc:
In some cosmological settings, this is a staff filled with mystical power. It can resonate with the Future Stars and show the way to them.

Of course, in some other settings, it might be an object kept in storage by an organization known as Akademiya, and perhaps its recorded name might even be Ayesha's Chaos Prospector. There is a thin layer of dust over this object due to a long period of disuse.

list.name: Future Star
list.desc:
In a certain cosmological setting, the Great Future Star is a precious treasure that contains hope and infinite possibility, and that Future Stars are naught but fragments of that larger whole. If you can gather all six fragments together, you can summon the true Greater Star forth. As for what this greater object looks like or what it can be used for, that has gone unstated.

Of course, in some other settings, it might be an object kept in storage by an organization known as the Akademiya, and perhaps its recorded name might even be the Parvo Core. There is a thin layer of dust over this object due to a long period of disuse.

list.name: Transient Resin
list.desc:
An item that can be used to replenish Original Resin. Once used, it will replenish 60 Original Resin.

Once obtained, it will automatically dissipate after a period of time.

· The expiration time will be calculated from the Monday after this item is obtained, and it will disappear seven days from then.

· Multiple Transient Resins obtained on different weeks will have their expiration dates counted independently.

Pure energy that will dissipate with time. In this, it is similar to all else that is lovely in this world. But seize this opportunity and go make the world a slightly better place, as is fitting for one who dwells within the bounds of "time."

list.name: Diagram: Electro Treasure Compass
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step diagram for making an Electro Treasure Compass. Use it to easily locate treasure all over Inazuma.

list.name: Diagram: Dendro Treasure Compass
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step diagram for making a Dendro Treasure Compass. Use it to easily locate treasure all over Sumeru.

list.name: Dendro Treasure Compass
list.desc:
A compass that can be used in Sumeru to search for nearby chests.

For some people, the significance of life lies in exploration and discovery. Upon reaching each destination, there is always bountiful treasure awaiting.

list.name: Fragile Resin
list.desc:
An item used to restore Original Resin by 60 points.

This crystalline substance pulsates with a little energy that can be absorbed by Original Resin. The flow of energies of all sorts is the source of many wonders and challenges in the world. Those same energies are also contained within this crystal.

list.name: Scarlet Sand Slate
list.desc:
This object has long been the subject of Akademiya Researcher Tirzad's research. Its etchings and craftsmanship indicate that it is a relic of King Deshret's civilization.

It seems to have the power to command devices within ruins associated with King Deshret...

list.name: "Kusava"
list.desc:
Equip it to utilize the power of Aranara.

"Fatty fruit, bitter fruit."

A temporary home for Aranara memories. Kusava makes Aranara strong.

list.name: Instructions: Electroculus Resonance Stone
list.desc: Detailed step-by-step instructions for making an Electroculus Resonance Stone. Master them and you will be able to create a tool to guide you to Electroculi.

list.name: Instructions: Dendroculus Resonance Stone
list.desc: Detailed step-by-step instructions for making a Dendroculus Resonance Stone. Master them and you will be able to create a tool to guide you to Dendroculi.

list.name: Dendroculus Resonance Stone
list.desc:
A stone that can be used in Sumeru to search for nearby Dendroculi.

A curious amulet of a similar nature to the Dendro Statues of The Seven. By the same token, it is drawn to Dendroculi.

In the world, there are grass and trees, vines and flowers — living beings of Dendro Element that abound in diverse shapes and forms. Though differing in appearance and various other aspects, they were born from the same land and will return to the same land.

list.name: Sumeru Shrine of Depths Key
list.desc:
A key that can break the seal on the ancient Shrines of Depths scattered around Sumeru.

These Shrines of Depths sealed themselves off when the civilization that built them was lost. Keys lost deep within domains are able to break the seals. Or perhaps that, for a moment, these keys help the seals to forget all that they have lost.

list.name: Quelled Creeper
list.desc:
The final coalesced form of the Dendro Hypostasis. The tough vines protect a pure cubic elemental crystal.

Dendro defies any common logic yet exists in perfect harmony with life. Elemental Hypostases, on the contrary, are most distant in appearance to all living beings. The combination of these two should probably never have appeared in this world. It is said that such elemental hypostases have the intelligence to "learn" and have thus understood the colors and dreams of the forest, a process that has transformed them into this shape over thousands of years.

list.name: Original Resin
list.desc: It is said that the roots of all the Irminsul trees and blossoms in the world are intertwined at the deepest, most hidden place in the earth, and that the pattern the root system makes defines the Ley Lines of the world.

list.name: Daka's Bell
list.desc:
This ball joint, used to connect mechanical limbs together, is shaped almost like a bell. Though it may seem dainty, it can be used to carry an unimaginably large amount of energy.

If connected to one's arms, then one will lose all feeling in them.

And all strength in one's legs will dissipate if such joints are connected to them.

Connect this joint to one's skull…

Ah, hatred, pain, madness, pride — none of these will be washed away.

Most fortunate.

list.name: Mirror of Mushin
list.desc:
The mirror that was set in Shouki no Kami's chest to separate him from the outside world. The mitsudomoe symbol is emblazoned on it as a deliberate show of status and might.

This symbol, however, is no show of obeisance to the master of lightning, but is instead a blade pointed at the existing powers that be in this world. Nor is the mirror a means to shut out the looks of judgment from onlooking people, but is rather a bulwark against this base and sullied world. Within this great temple shall punishment be meted out and ignorance be cleansed.

Dreams shall be overturned, desires shall be cut away, and karma shall be reset.

list.name: Puppet Strings
list.desc:
Tubes that were inserted into the mechanical puppet's back. The colors that flow within them are sometimes dull, and at others, vibrant. The contrast is so great as to be fearful.

They provided power to the mechanical puppet, and at the same time served as its strings, controlling it and binding it.

Once the support of these tubes is lost, the puppet becomes as weak as a newborn babe, barely able to even move.

list.name: Recipe: Fish With Cream Sauce
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Fish With Cream Sauce.

list.name: Recipe: Potato Boat
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making a Potato Boat.

list.name: Recipe: Tandoori Roast Chicken
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Tandoori Roast Chicken.

list.name: Aranyaka
list.desc:
Arama handed this book over to you.

It seems to have witnessed the passage of many years. By the look of things, someone used to keep records in it, but none of that can be retrieved now.

Use it to document your shared adventure with Arama.

list.name: Picture of the Transaction
list.desc:
A picture of a scene where the "Divine Knowledge Capsule" is being traded.

In the picture, there is Mizri, the leader of Ayn Al-Ahmar, and the Divine Knowledge Capsule giving off a red glow in his hand.

list.name: Bag of Intel Transaction Funds
list.desc: A bag of Mora provided by Alhaitham for buying the intel on the whereabouts of the Divine Knowledge Capsule.

list.name: Activated・Canned Knowledge
list.desc: Canned Knowledge labeled "Swordfighting Techniques VIII." It was bought from Dori's booth at the price of 100,000 Mora at Paimon's instigation. You have no idea where the first seven in the series are, but things like "Combat Techniques" will always be useful. Well, probably.

list.name: Canned Knowledge "Swordfighting Techniques VIII"
list.desc: Canned Knowledge labeled "Swordfighting Techniques VIII." It was bought from Dori's booth at the price of 100,000 Mora at Paimon's instigation. You have no idea where the first seven in the series are, but things like "Combat Techniques" will always be useful. Well, probably.

list.name: Package of Canned Knowledge
list.desc: Canned Knowledge purchased at Dori's booth with the Mora given to you by Alhaitham. Packaged as common commodities to keep it low-key.

list.name: Informant Code Chart
list.desc:
A code chart given to you by Alhaitham. Seems like whoever seeks to purchase "special commodities" from Dori has to provide the right code first.

Check this code chart before visiting Dori's contact, just in case.

list.name: Bag of Transaction Funds
list.desc: A bag of Mora given by Alhaitham for purchasing Canned Knowledge. You can feel the heavy weight of the bag.

list.name: Tighnari's Introduction Letter
list.desc:
A letter from Tighnari to Rohawi, a researcher from Amurta. In the letter, Tighnari requests that Rohawi use his prowess in collecting information to help you.

Rohawi's address in Sumeru City is also attached therein.

list.name: Box Lunch from the Traveler
list.desc: Food that you have specifically prepared for Haypasia. The box contains Sweet Madame and Radish Veggie Soup. You hope Haypasia will like it.

list.name: Keystone (II)
list.desc: A stone slate with some kind of power remaining within it. It can be used to open nearby paths. Well, one might suppose that this is some ancient key, right?

list.name: Keystone (I)
list.desc: A stone slate with some kind of power remaining within it. It can be used to open nearby paths. Well, one might suppose that this is some ancient key, right?

list.name: A Short Letter
list.desc: A short letter that was written in code. You do not know who wrote it or why, but it has ended up here all the same.

list.name: Garland
list.desc:
A garland woven by Arama.

Garlands of this kind represent the blessings from all of Vanarana and once channeled endless powers during the fight with Marana's Avatar. But their blazing light has now faded, perhaps because they burned so relentlessly.

Every flower on the garland is connected with the lovely, tiny heart of an Aranara, and all of them together constitute the gate to Mahavanaranapna. Aranara will support those who wear such garlands. As friends, they ease the wearers' pains, ward off their nightmares, aid them through lightless days, and fill the emptiness in their hearts.

list.name: Arana's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Arana.

You promised Arana that the evil shall be punished.

list.name: Araja's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Araja.

Araja seems to have lost important memories.

list.name: Ararycan's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Ararycan.

There is neither soil nor water inside the Ruin Golem. It must be a nightmarish place for Ararycan.

list.name: Arapandu's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Arapandu.

Can power the Varuna Contraption and adjust the amount of water contained within the earth, thus breathing new life into the forest.

list.name: Arakunti's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Arakunti.

Happy moments spent with friends are like Nilotpala Lotuses in the water.

list.name: Aranakula's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Aranakula.

Fearful though Aranakula was, this little creature still ventured into the Fungus-infested forest to tend to "the Memory of Stone."

list.name: Arakara's Flower
list.desc:
"A flower gifted to you by Arakara.

For Arakara, who nurtures Viparyas, flowers given to friends must be most precious indeed.

list.name: Arabalika's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Arabalika.

It seems to contain the power to destroy a Ruin Guard with one strike.

list.name: Araesha's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Araesha.

The biggest mystery is perhaps why Araesha describes the riddles as being "delicious"... Is it because they are all about food?"

list.name: Aralila and Aranishat's Flowers
list.desc:
Flowers gifted by Aralila and Aranishat.

We ourselves are the strongest. Of that, there is no doubt!

list.name: Arakanta's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Arakanta.

Arakanta used to love hanging out with Rishboland Tigers. But now, he has created a new game for his Nara friend.

list.name: The Siblings' Flowers
list.desc:
Flowers gifted by Arapacati and her brothers.

Longing to be connected as "siblings" are, these Aranara have each taken on the role of sister or brother. Their obsession with cooking stems from the wish to share food with family.

That being said, an Aranara's tastebuds are not to be trusted.

list.name: Nameless Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by an unknown Aranara.

A symbol of Aranara friendship. One who receives this flower willingly recognizes this friendship.

list.name: Zohrah Mushroom
list.desc: One of the ingredients for making the elixir Arahaoma. "Zohrah" is said to mean "lost in a tipsy dream."

list.name: Barsam Flower
list.desc: One of the ingredients for making the elixir Arahaoma. "Barsam" is said to be a sacred tree that has long vanished in history.

list.name: Aranaga's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Aranaga

"Season of rain returns, plants rejoice... The pomegranate sings, the apples clap."

list.name: Aranakin's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Aranakin

"Wind that doesn't return, water that doesn't flow backwards... Sweet dreams and bitter aftertastes."

list.name: Aragaru's Flower
list.desc:
A flower gifted to you by Aragaru

"Old leaves, swollen fruit... Drifted dreams, fallen flowers."

list.name: Withered Kusava
list.desc: Entirely drained of strength, the Kusava appears withered. Yet the seed, which preserves precious memories, is still alive.

list.name: Vasoma Fruit
list.desc: A fruit with mysterious powers. Bija is indispensable for helping Rana, and the Vasoma Fruit is indispensable for obtaining Bija.

list.name: Suspicious Rose Custard
list.desc: A dessert made from fermented milk. It appears to be fine, but as soon as you try some... your teeth will quiver due to the unbearable acidity. The lack of seasoning can still be made up for by adding more sugar. However, that lingering sourness is hardly something that can be easily forgotten.

list.name: Delicious Rose Custard
list.desc: A dessert made from fermented milk. When mixed together, the dense curd, fragrant petals, and crisp nuts together create a mellow and sweet taste. As that fragrant milky concoction slips down your throat, it is almost as if you can smell the floral scent from a long time ago.

list.name: Rose Custard
list.desc: A dessert made from fermented milk. Once the milk is fermented and filtered into yogurt, stir sugar in before garnishing with dried roses and chopped nuts. In the beginning, this dish was only popular among adventurers and traveling merchants, but now, it is served as breakfast and a tea-time dessert across Sumeru.

list.name: Recipe: Rose Custard
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Rose Custard.

list.name: Halvamazd
list.desc: Nahida's specialty. It is said that "mazd" means "wisdom" in Sumeru, and such delicate "wisdom" is simply irresistible. There is a gentle smile in Nahida's eyes: "The sea anemone has helped the little fish and witnessed its growth, so it's only natural for the little fish to give something back."

list.name: "The Ultra Invincible" Adventure Handbook
list.desc: The Adventure Handbook left in the secret base seems to have recorded the children's adventure stories and various interesting anectodes, though the meandering scribbles make them nigh illegible...

list.name: Amiti Device Fragment (I)
list.desc: A fragment of an ancient ruin device. It is believed that when completed, this device can be used to open the cabin door of a Ruin Golem.

list.name: Amiti Device Fragment (II)
list.desc: A fragment of an ancient ruin device. It is believed that when completed, this device can be used to open the cabin door of a ruin Golem.

list.name: Amiti Device Fragment (III)
list.desc: A fragment of an ancient ruin device. It is believed that when completed, this device can be used to open the cabin door of a Ruin Golem.

list.name: Dried Flower
list.desc: A flower pressed inside the Adventure Handbook. It seems to have preserved someone's lost memories...

list.name: Living Spring
list.desc: Water obtained from the source of the rivers flowing across Apam Woods. According to Arapas, soup made from this spring water is a Supreme Delicacy. But one wonders if it really is any different from ordinary water...

list.name: Arahaoma
list.desc: An elixir of Aranara. A mere drop of it is all it takes to unveil Aranara's pure and pristine dreams to the forest.

list.name: Bija
list.desc: The crystallization of what is most precious to Aranara. It is not only a fruit but also a seed of hope.

list.name: Jazari's Mora Purse
list.desc: This heavy Mora purse contains Jazari's research grants for half a year. If all the funds in there were used up by accident, Jazari would sure have an outburst of crying...

list.name: "The Best Water"
list.desc: Water collected in Vanarana, clear, cold and refreshing - a leaf falling on top of it would look as if floating in the air. This is transparent water of extraordinary quality.

list.name: Fresh Slime Condensate
list.desc: Slime Condensate that looks really fresh. Who knows what Garcia needs it for...

list.name: Azalai's Payment
list.desc: Azalai's payment. It feels quite substantial...

list.name: Rama's Receipt
list.desc: A receipt you got from Rama. It can be used to collect goods purchased from Rama.

list.name: Whopperflower Root Soil
list.desc: Soil collected from Whopperflower roots. What will Akim use it for?

list.name: Gulabgir's Special Pet Snake Food
list.desc: Special pet snake food prepared by Gulabgir. One wonders what it tastes like...

list.name: Prescription Medication from Bimarstan for Aftab
list.desc: Medication prescribed for Aftab. Taker of this medication needs to practice a bland diet.

list.name: Moist Soil
list.desc: Moist soil collected from the bottom of rocks. What will Akim use it for?

list.name: Zakariya's Prescription for Maruf
list.desc: The words on this prescription resemble nothing so much as a serpentine dance. You can barely make out the phrases...

list.name: Prescription Medication from Bimarstan for Azra
list.desc: Medication prescribed for Azra. It smells incredibly bitter.

list.name: Sareh's Note
list.desc: This time, we are looking for a kitten named...

list.name: Sacred Seal: Dune
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The civilization from the era of King Deshret had different words for dunes of different shapes, something that has brought researchers no lack of headaches.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Sandstorm
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The shape of this symbol should be derived from the storms that ravage the desert.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Labor
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The symbol here appeared at the same time as the chisel hammer, and is one of the earliest words to emerge.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Giant Serpent
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Though Haravatat researchers believe this to be a symbol for a giant serpent, Amurta researchers have proposed a different view, arguing that the Great Red Sand is not home to any snakes. As such, the meaning of and inspiration for this word is still being contested.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Ceremony
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The original meaning of this symbol was most likely "sacrifice," with an extended meaning of "rites" or "ceremonies" emerging later.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Crocodile Head
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The source of this symbol is probably the Spinocrocodile's frighteningly huge maw.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Right to Rule
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? This symbol is the spitting image of a ruler seated upon a throne.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Sheep Head
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building, though the origin of this writing seems unclear. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Most believe that the etchings here symbolize a sheep's head.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Sunrise
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The origin of this symbol is the rising sun.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Chisel Hammer
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The symbol for a chisel hammer is one of the earliest words to emerge.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Danger
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The symbol seems to indicate the hazardous circumstance of hanging a chisel hammer on a cliff, and is thought to have emerged at a later date.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Thunderstrike
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The shape of this symbol should be derived from the lightning that is ever so rare a sight in the desert.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Forest
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? A majority of researchers believe this to represent the forest, and that this suggests that the modern-day desert was not always a desolate wasteland.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Bird Head
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Most believe the etchings here symbolize a bird's head.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Auricle
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? The symbol on this plate looks like an auricle, but a consensus has not been reached on this matter.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Valley
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Either way, researchers believe this symbol to have initially stood for "valley."

list.name: Glinting Component
list.desc: A piece of the Primal Construct that barred your path. This component seems to be reacting with nearby devices, constantly gleaming and glinting as it does.

list.name: Sacred Seal: Raised Arm
list.desc: A stone plate with ancient text on it that seems to have once been part of a certain building. The desert sands play host to many an unknown wish. Who made them, and who carries them now? Either way, researchers believe this symbol to have been a phonetic symbol, and that its extended meanings may have included respect or submission.

list.name: Torn Page: A Thousand Nights (VI)
list.desc:
Collect all 10 pages to form A Thousand Nights (VI).

This flimsy page has seemingly dropped from the spine of a storybook of storied age.

Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

list.name: Torn Page: A Thousand Nights (V)
list.desc:
Collect all 10 pages to form A Thousand Nights (V).

This flimsy page has seemingly dropped from the spine of a storybook of storied age.

Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

list.name: Ancient Key
list.desc: A key stolen by a Masked Weasel. If there is a key, then there must be a lock that matches it. But what would an abandoned hospital still have to hide?

list.name: Torn Page: A Thousand Nights (IV)
list.desc:
Collect all 10 pages to form A Thousand Nights (IV).

This flimsy page has seemingly dropped from the spine of a storybook of storied age.

Perhaps you might be able to reconstruct the complete text, should you find other torn pages elsewhere.

list.name: Unsealed Parchment
list.desc: An ancient and mysterious roll of parchment. It looks like a note left by an adventurer. New words keep appearing on it.

list.name: “Emergency Adjustment Plan”
list.desc: This map was contained within the plans that a Fatuus named Oleg accidentally dropped. All the encampment positions and Fatui patrol routes have been marked on here.

list.name: Raef's Package
list.desc: This package contains a pot, flower seeds, fertilizer, and many other gardening supplies. It is very heavy indeed. It will be quite difficult to carry it across the desert...

list.name: A Research Paper by Pir Kavikavus
list.desc: This paper is titled "Theory and Practice: Enhancing the Safety of the Chaos Core in Unstable Conditions Using the Khaenri'ah Ruin Golem of Devantaka Mountain as an Example." The body of the paper is riddled with jargon. If you are not a senior Kshahrewar researcher, chances are that the paper's argument will be no less than unfathomable.

list.name: Javi's Dream
list.desc: A box containing a dream. However, the one who once cherished the dream has long forgotten about it.

list.name: Rose Sprout
list.desc: A flower sprouting in the faded Withering Zone, tender yet tough.

list.name: Florescent Talisman
list.desc: A talisman woven with childish skills. Its meaning remains unknown. The Dendro energy in it keeps the flower fresh for a long time. But apart from that, there is nothing special about this talisman.

list.name: Limited Edition Desert Special Travel Pack
list.desc: A travel bag you purchased from Dori. All manner of curiosities are contained within. You can't quite make sense of its contents, but on further examination, they all seem quite useful...

list.name: A Note Alrani Left for Niloofar
list.desc:
A note Alrani left for her tutor Niloofar. The handwriting is fairly sloppy, but the writer pressed so hard on the paper that anyone reading the note can immediately feel her then intense emotions.

"I HATE writing papers!"

list.name: Ancient Map
list.desc: A map that you found in Taj's room. It shows the location of the Court of Desolation.

list.name: Auction Information
list.desc: Information regarding an auction that Dori collected and compiled. You can find details concerning the Canned Knowledge auction being held in the desert here.

list.name: Strange Sumeru Rose
list.desc: A Sumeru Rose affected by the Ley Lines. It seems a little different from normal...

list.name: Transparent Ruins Record (III)
list.desc: A stone slate that you found in the transparent ruins near the Mausoleum of King Deshret. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.

list.name: Cyno's Introduction Letter
list.desc: A recommendation that Cyno wrote for you. It represents the trust the General Mahamatra places in you.

list.name: Record of the Tomb of Carouses
list.desc: A stone slate that you found in the Tomb of Carouses. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.

list.name: Record of Lamb-Devourer Rock
list.desc: A stone slate that you found in the secret Eremite base within Lamb-Devourer Rock. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.

list.name: Transparent Ruins Record (I)
list.desc: A stone slate that you found in the transparent ruins near the Mausoleum of King Deshret. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.

list.name: Transparent Ruins Record (II)
list.desc: A stone slate that you found in the transparent ruins near the Mausoleum of King Deshret. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.

list.name: Soheil's Old Notes
list.desc: These are the notes left by Soheil, an Akademiya researcher, who entered the desert to study when he was young. They look very old, but they are not crinkled.

list.name: Record of Aaru's Shut
list.desc: A stone slate that you found at the highest point of the The Mausoleum of King Deshret. This seems to be a record left by a lost civilization.

list.name: Serendipity
list.desc:
If you can stay within the Ideal Tension Zone while fishing, this rod will shorten the time in which fish will struggle by a stable amount and increase your chances of success. This effect only works in Sumeru.

This archaic Sumeru fishing rod is carved like white jade, decorated with dark gold patterns, and embellished with green gems. Under its pure aesthetics, it seems to have some meaning related to "life" — it is said that the oldest fishing rod of Sumeru was a branch wrapped with vines, and many master anglers achieved miraculous catches with such rods. Today's fishermen also believe that such fishing rods with long histories will bring them good luck.

list.name: Extravagant Slumber
list.desc: Layla's specialty. The scattered nuts are like stars dotted in the deep and quiet night sky. After just one bite, your body and mind after a day's work suddenly felt relaxed and peaceful. When you told Layla about that feeling, she showed a mixed expression of joy and regret - "Th-That's great! Ah, if only it could work on me too."

list.name: Mysterious Parchment
list.desc: An ancient and mysterious roll of parchment. It seems to contain the final destiny of an adventurer...

list.name: Whispering Parchment
list.desc: An ancient and mysterious roll of parchment. It looks like a note left by an adventurer. New words keep appearing on it.

list.name: Guiding Parchment
list.desc: An ancient and mysterious roll of parchment. It looks like a note left by an adventurer. New words keep appearing on it.

list.name: Strange Parchment
list.desc: An ancient and mysterious roll of parchment. It looks like a note left by an adventurer.

list.name: Traditionally-Made Charcoal-Baked Ajilenakh Cake
list.desc: Faruzan's specialty. The dark and sweet cake, lying as it does atop a minty-green sauce bed, almost looks like some enigmatic mechanism. Your hesitation must have somehow reached Faruzan, for she then straightened up to assertively reassure you that this was a traditional dish in Sumeru and that its flavor is guaranteed. But you can't help wondering... Is it really a 'traditional' dish that catered to the tastes of Sumeru people a hundred years ago?

list.name: Shimi Chazuke
list.desc:
Wanderer's specialty. The mildly bitter fragrance of tea and the refreshingly sweet aroma of rice are perfectly blended together, leaving you to wolf it down insatiably. How did he manage to cook something so extraordinary? Ah, your expression must have betrayed this thought to him, for his face suddenly turns grim:

"Have you finished yet? Stop gawking and go wash the dishes now."

list.name: Beginner Player Badge
list.desc:
They say that anyone who starts out with Genius Invokation TCG can obtain this particular Player Badge.

Even the mightiest player starts from this point, building their personal legends as they go along.

Stay tuned, player — your saga begins here!

list.name: Blank Dynamic Card
list.desc: A blank card with a painted back. It is said that if you put the name of your desired dynamic card on this blank card, you can get the very skin from the Association agent located at the tavern.

list.name: Match Invitation Letter
list.desc: You can select a player from the Player List via the invitation board, and then entrust The Cat's Tail to send out an invitation using this Invitation Letter. The invited player will head over to the tavern and wait for a duel with you.

list.name: Lucky Coin
list.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

list.name: Casket of Tomes
list.desc:
A box for cards released by the Genius Invokation TCG Society.

Only beginners who have learned the basic rules and are verified as players can collect one.

They say that these boxes were made by researchers from the Sumeru Akademiya, and that they feature a special mechanism that can be used to detect nearby people who also possess Caskets of Tomes.

Use this function to engage in more matches against nearby players!

list.name: Samosa
list.desc: A deep-fried snack. The well-stirred filling is wrapped in a thin crust, shaped into a triangle, then fried in a pan until golden brown. Both meat and vegetarian fillings are common, so the dish has become a point of conflict for those with a strong preference for one over the other.

list.name: Suspicious Samosa
list.desc: A deep-fried snack. Its greasy crust and aggressively strong-flavored filling easily stifle one's desire for a second bite, even with the attempt to balance the flavor using Mint - an attempt that has apparently failed.

list.name: Delicious Samosa
list.desc: A deep-fried snack. Each golden, crispy pocket is stuffed full with a soft, glutinous filling. You can't help but wolf one down immediately, and then reach out for a second one, taking your time to savor it... Piece by piece, you become lost in the dish's enticing aroma, and before you know it, you are only left with an empty plate.

list.name: Recipe: Samosa
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Samosa.

list.name: Parasol Talcum
list.desc:
Specialized refinement material for "Toukabou Shigure."
A powdery substance meant to bind bamboo to an umbrella.
Even as the seasons change and the past dissolves, memory and thoughts will always remain, slumbering beneath an umbrella to rest in the shroud of a dream.

list.name: Courage Test Ticket
list.desc:
Ticket earned from a participant's display of courage and insight by completing special challenges in the "Test of Courage" event hosted by the Yashiro Commission.
You can exchange these tickets for rewards during the "Akitsu Kimodameshi" event.

list.name: Silver Twig
list.desc:
A new branch taken from the center of the world.

There was once a giant tree that ran across the world, and this twig was part of it. Though it has been removed from the tree, their connection remains strong as ever.

Therefore, as long as the giant white tree that symbolizes the center of the world does not die, it will never wither.

"Trees" symbolize life. In one of the stories from a certain place, there was a person who had entrusted her consciousness to the white tree's branches before she passed away. In that way, neither her life nor hope would be lost, since the branches would grow and sprout where there was sunshine and rain, and would one day blossom and bear fruits.

"Trees" also symbolize wisdom. In one of the legends, a sage hanging upside down on a tree had acquired the knowledge of how to inscribe runes and control sacred words, and thus followed the kingdom established along the tree's roots, eventually gaining a glimpse of the secret of the cosmos.

All knowledge, memory, and experience flow through this giant tree, just like a stream flows into a river, the river joins a sea, the sea turns into clouds, and the clouds rain onto the ground - just like life itself.

list.name: An Appellative Stroke
list.desc:
The brush with which you may bestow a new name upon a certain person.

Once the new name has been given, it cannot be changed.

list.name: Delicious Potato Boat
list.desc: A baked appetizer. The oozing cheese flows forth like a golden river, carrying an alluring aroma into your mouth. Soon, you will be amazed by the freshness of the Rukkhashava Mushrooms and the softness of the potato. You can't help but wish that this leisurely and savory tour might last a little longer…

list.name: Delicious Fish With Cream Sauce
list.desc: A fish dish served in sauce. The translucent fillet lies upon exquisite cream sauce. With only a small mouthful, one might even see fish leaping on the sea surface.

list.name: Suspicious Tandoori Roast Chicken
list.desc: A signature chicken dish of Sumeru. Baked in high heat, the chicken has become dry and wooden. The overabundance of seasonings has covered the original scent of the ingredients. Even someone who likes jerky will need a bottle of water to help swallow the meat.

list.name: Delicious Tandoori Roast Chicken
list.desc: A signature chicken dish of Sumeru. The vibrant flames have locked the umami inside the chicken's reddened skin. Once it slips into your mouth, the rich flavor will awaken your every taste bud. The chicken and spices seem to have performed a mysterious Sumeru dance on the tip of your tongue, evoking the image of a festive banquet…

list.name: Suspicious Fish With Cream Sauce
list.desc: A fish dish served in sauce. The outside was burnt in searing hot oil. It is rather hard not to notice the sharp contrast between the charcoal-black fish and the milk-white sauce. Only the meat inside seems edible… Wait, what's with this sourness?

list.name: Tandoori Roast Chicken
list.desc: A signature chicken dish of Sumeru. The chicken was first marinated with red spices, and then roasted in a tandoor. The process of making this Sumeru classic does not involve any fancy skills, and the use of such a humble clay oven might be surprising to some. In Sumeru, a tandoor to a veteran chef is as important as a trusty sword to an adventurer.

list.name: Fish With Cream Sauce
list.desc: A fish dish served in sauce. Fresh fish filets were dried before pan-fried until crispy, then drizzled with a creamy white dressing and sprinkled with fresh mint. A unique dish that can be made through the simplest methods.

list.name: Suspicious Potato Boat
list.desc: A baked appetizer. The undercooked potato even has dirt on it… A failed attempt at cooking, it seems, and even the cheese that usually goes well with any other ingredients will not be able to save the day.

list.name: Master Player Badge
list.desc:
Those who reach the level at which they may complete the Master player Trial shall receive this Player Badge.

They say that few are the players who can obtain this badge, and each of them has their own unique take on the game.

Victory, it seems, may no longer be the sole object here.

list.name: Expert Player Badge
list.desc:
Those who study the art of playing Genius Invokation TCG and clear the Expert Player Trial match will obtain this Player Badge.

Perhaps your attitude at this point is markedly different from when you first began, but you still find new joy in playing—
In willingly putting time into something you find interesting, and in enjoying all that comprises that which you love.

list.name: Advanced Player Badge
list.desc:
Those who play Genius Invokation TCG often and complete the Advanced Player Trial match will obtain this Player Badge.

Many are those who become players, but the vast majority treat the game as a sort of pastime, and so those who become Advanced Players are few and far between.

Even games do provide the dedicated with unique rewards.

list.name: Wilderness Compass
list.desc: A special compass obtained from the Adventurers' Guild. According to certain rumors, it might just offer you a sprinkle of extra luck...

list.name: Legend Player Badge
list.desc:
Those who clear the Legend Player Trial will obtain this Player Badge.

This badge proves that you are well on your way to carving out your own unique mythos as a player.

Go forth, go beyond, and reach new heights!

list.name: Sand Grease Pupa
list.desc: You can only find such husks deep in the desert where the Quicksand Eels breed. The hardened shell is meant to protect the Quicksand Eel's larval bodies until they finally acclimate to the conditions of the dry desert.

list.name: Pseudo-Stamens
list.desc: The pale wing-sheathes hiding in the Wenut's tail are as thin as the blooming stamens of a flower. It is said that in the past, even before the beginning of time, they used to travel under meadows and forests, similar to birds flying across the sky and fish swimming in the water. It is generally believed that their mimicry of flowers is to lure lost prey caught by sandstorms. There is also a theory, however, that their imitation of a blooming flower was inspired by the splendid blossoms countless epochs ago, which have long gone the way of the desert winds.

list.name: Recipe: Sabz Meat Stew
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Sabz Meat Stew.

list.name: Sabz Meat Stew
list.desc: A meat stew with a unique taste. A variety of vegetables are mixed together, then chopped into small pieces and stewed with meat. The addition of lemons gives the final product a mildly sour taste. The people of Sumeru usually enjoy this dish over rice.

list.name: Suspicious Sabz Meat Stew
list.desc: A meat stew with a unique taste. The sourness feels a little too much. The scent itself inspires not-so-appetizing associations... Leave it be for a while longer, and it might just become the perfect breeding ground for Fungi.

list.name: Delicious Sabz Meat Stew
list.desc: A meat stew with a unique taste. The fragrant ingredients complement each other perfectly. Large pieces of fresh meat are stewed until tender and coated in dark green, as if inviting all who taste it for a leisurely stroll in the forest.

list.name: Recipe: Scented Meat Balls
list.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Scented Meat Balls.

list.name: Scented Meat Balls
list.desc: A dish with ground meat as its base. After crushing the wheat and cooking it over a fire, ground meat was added to form the outer layer. Onions and meat were then stir-fried to make the filling. Finally, the mixture was molded into balls and deep-fried until golden. Enjoying meat by the mouthful has never been this easy!

list.name: Suspicious Scented Meat Balls
list.desc: A dish with ground meat as its base. One may find it hard to guess what's inside based on its dull appearance. If you try taking a small bite... Yep, there's wheat in there. It'll probably scrape your lips if you're not careful enough.

list.name: Delicious Scented Meat Balls
list.desc: A dish with ground meat as its base. The crunchy and chewy coating wraps around the savory filling, giving it a layered texture that's easily a cut above regular meatballs. Try eating one, and its irresistible aroma will leave you brimming with satisfaction.

list.name: Ideal Circumstance
list.desc: Alhaitham's specialty. A dish created through the fusion of vegetables and meat prepared in a patterned frying pan. Improvements were made to the recipe, making it taste quite different from the original dish. The words on the food mean "contemplation." In the words of the creator: "Ideally, everyone should be capable of contemplation, but practically, it doesn't seem very possible."

list.name: Qingce Household Dish
list.desc: Yaoyao's specialty. It looks rather mundane as it is not displayed with the same luxurious aesthetic as dishes prepared by a fancy restaurant. However, as soon as you take a bite, the flavor immediately offers you a fragrant and intimate experience, certain to leave an ever-lasting impression. After a single taste, what's on your tongue will be on your heart for good. As for the reason, maybe the secret ingredient to this recipe is simply "caring."

list.name: Marked Shell
list.desc:
The marked shell of a Consecrated Beast inscribed with ancient script.
On the pallid contours of the shell, the regrets of a time long past have been inlaid. One day, the bones of the beast will scatter like dust in the wind, and then, finally, may the exalted deceased greet their final rest...

list.name: Desiccated Shell
list.desc:
The ruined shell of a Consecrated Beast.
A tangible effigy to the grand calamity that devoured the lands of yore, usually only discovered in places few dare tread.

list.name: Sturdy Shell
list.desc:
The sturdy shell of a Consecrated Beast.
The remains of a ruinous beast that once gnawed at the flesh of great, fallen beings. Even should the beasts sup a sliver of power from the gods of yesteryear, they too will greet the same end as said gods.

list.name: Crocodile Jerky
list.desc:
Crocodile jerky prepared using a special recipe of the Tanit tribe. Though a bit hard to chew, the meat's ease of storage makes it a commonly consumed delicacy for tribal hunters.

Despite tasting like fowl, the nutritional value of crocodile meat is said to be eight times more than the flesh of more typical beasts...

list.name: Mysterious Meat
list.desc: A fresh chunk of meat that seems to be radiating an enigmatic aura. Wonder what it'll taste like?

list.name: Primogem
list.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

list.name: Nascent Bamboo Shoots
list.desc: During certain seasons, the Bamboo Shoots grown in Qingce Village will release a most delectable fragrance, the scent betraying its status as a most vaunted ingredient for certain recipes.

list.name: Piping-Hot Bamboo Shoot Soup
list.desc: Bamboo Shoot Soup created using the Supreme Cuisine Machine. Zhongli rated this dish as such: "The appearance is exquisite, and the aroma rich and intense." Among its key ingredients are Nascent Bamboo Shoots. They're hard to come by... And due to a multiplicity of reasons, their commemorative value far exceeds their worth as cooking ingredients. Since this meal was created by an adeptus, it shouldn't spoil even if you just leave it in your bag.

list.name: Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar
list.desc:
Born from water lilies, Liloupar, the great Jinni, whose soul had been shattered due to an ancient punishment, was sealed in a transparent magic bottle.
Now, it seems that she has found a new master...

Although she only possesses a-hundred millionth of her previous great power, she will use what is left of her to help her master pass through the hot sand and ancient ruins of the Desert of Hadramaveth.

list.name: Prescription Medication from Bimarstan for Gurgen
list.desc: Medication prescribed for Gurgen. It should be taken along with abundant rest.

list.name: Tadhla's Feather
list.desc: The feathers needed for a falcon to take flight. If they are plucked, then flight will become all but impossible...

list.name: Fatui Stronghold Key
list.desc: A key to the front gates of the Fatui stronghold in the desert. It should open their massive doors without any issues. Here's hoping...

list.name: Flying Serpent's Horn
list.desc: This, as the name implies, is the horn of a flying serpent. The tribes of the desert will grind it down to powder to make ineffective potions and tout these creations as potent tonics to swindle researchers in the city. It sells quite well.

list.name: Scorpion's Sting
list.desc: A scorpion's stinger and the connected poison glands. A certifiable classic instrument for assassinations in the desert.

list.name: Red Vulture's Feather
list.desc: The feathers that abet a red vulture's ability of flight. It can be used to create vibrant pigments... Or even lethal poisons.

list.name: Note Regarding an Exchange of Goods
